sense.name: lead a performance (usually music)
sense.commentary: Syntax Is: NP1[agent[human]] CONDUCT NP2 Note: NP2 is understood to entail humans, even if not referenced explicitly.
sense.examples: I heard Berstein conduct Mahler's Ninth in Philadelphia. It is challenging to conduct twelve tone music. The general conducted his troops in battle with brilliant military acumen.

sense.name: manage, handle, or control something
sense.commentary: Syntax Is: NP1[agent] CONDUCT NP[patient] PP Note: often refers to habitual or ongoing events, rather than a single temporally-bounded one.
sense.examples: He conducted his business from home for two years. The army is conducting war games in the Indian Ocean. Jane will conduct the surveys for our group.

sense.name: behave,act
sense.examples: Please conduct yourselves as ladies and gentlemen. He is conducting himself bravely through this difficult time. Those children couldn't conduct themselves appropriately in the restaurant.

sense.name: carry,transmit,transport
sense.examples: Many metals conduct heat. Does water conduct sound waves well? The trucks conducted the wounded to the hospital.

sense.name: lead or guide to a location
sense.examples: The butler conducted us into the library. That senile man was conducting traffic again on Main Street. The naughty puppy got conducted straight into the back yard.
